info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 08 at 9:31PM EDT until April 09 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, freezing temperatures reaching 32 degrees expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 to 32 degrees possible. * WHERE...Greater Caldwell County in the North Carolina northern foothills. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM EDT Saturday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Saturday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation, and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
